newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia sugar leaders agree on 5.3 m/t fcst.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia sugar leaders agree on 5.3 m/t fcst.

text.p: Australian sugar industry leaders supported the prediction of a 5.30 million tonne sugar crop for Australia in 1996 by the Australian Sugar Milling Council.

David Rutledge, chief executive of the Queensland Sugar Corp and Ross Chapman, deputy general manager industry management of grower organisation CANEGROWERS, both said the forecast of 5.30 million tonnes was "probably right".

John Desmarchelier, general manager of the Australian Sugar Milling Council, told an International Sugar Organisation seminar in London on Wednesday that Australia should produce 5.30 million tonnes of sugar in calendar 1996, up from 4.99 million tonnes the year before.
Australia's sugar crush season normally runs from May to end-December, although a small amount of crush may be conducted in early January in a late crush year.
